author: Volker

comments.message: I like that the wearer's face is visible - it definitely would help the caretaker appear less scary! What are your thoughts about getting oxygen cartridges and the factor of price? Also, this might seem like a silly question, but how do people put it on/take it off?

Hi there,oxygene cartridges  - honestly, I don't know, this is a brainstorm. However, it might be worth taking a close look at scuba diving equipment, there are minimal rescue packages available. Maybe one cartridge is enough to keep the pressure inside higher than outside. This would be a cost cut. The oxygen cartridge might be enough.How to take it on or off?On: I can imagine this works like putting on a sweater. It could be neatly folded inside an large envelope or container. Off: maybe there is a mechanism similar to the zipper on a wetsuit, that allows you to open the gear with a simple motion while covering the potentially contaminated outside.

description:
- low cost, blow molded, see through half body suit
- pressure cartridge to keep  overpressure inside suit
- oxygen cartridge (or whatever you need to breath)
- one way valve to let used air out
summary: This low cost, half body suit is intended to protect family members and care takers.This is not the ideal solution - but it could lower the hurdles of using  protection at all. The suit should be worn over your "normal" clothes but still create a safe environment inside. With that, it should feel a bit more human.
title: Half body suit
